bibl.title: Mummy Portraits in their Roman Context.
Portraits and Masks. Burial Customs in Roman Egypt
bibl.author: WALKER, Susan E.C.

bibl.note: Introduction. - The Mummy Portrait as a Genre of Roman Provincial Funerary Portraiture. - The Beginnings of Mummy Portraiture. - The Significance of the Starting Date. - The Portrayal of Roman Identity. - Paintings from er-Rubayat. - The Cemeteries of er-Rubayat and Hawara. - Mummy Portraits and the Ã‰lite of the Fayum. - The Display of Mummy Portraits. - Summary.
WALKER Susan E.C., Mummy Portraits in their Roman Context.
Morris L. BIERBRIER (Ed.), Portraits and Masks. Burial Customs in Roman Egypt (London, 1997) pp. 1-6 et pll. 1-2 et 17-18.
